intro: Boehmeria rugosissima, commonly known as roughleaf nettle, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae and is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its fibrous stems have been historically used for making textiles and paper.
